entries.meaning: (obsolete) The act of spotting; a spot; a blemish.
examples: He could make out a mottled pattern on the hollow cheeksâ€”the maculations of decay.

entries.meaning: (zoology, botany, chiefly uncountable) A pattern of spots.
examples: Females [of the species Speyeria nokomis] are cream above with heavy black maculation accompanied by much dark suffusion.
